Let $K$ be a number field and let $E$ be an elliptic curve over $K$. By
$E(K)$ we denote the set of points in $E$ with coordinates in $K$.

$E(K)$ is a finitely generated abelian group.

The proof of this theorem is fairly involved. The main two ingredients
are the so called , the concept of height function for abelian groups
and the “” theorem.\
See $\cite{silverman}$, Chapter VIII, page 189.
